data.text:
News | US Politics

When is the US presidential election 2024? Trump wins big in Iowa caucuses

Donald Trump secures a landslide victory in the Iowa caucuses, cementing his status as the clear frontrunner for the 2024 Republican presidential nomination

Will Joe Biden be re-elected as US president in 2024?

Getty Images

Nuray Bulbul16 January 2024

The 2024 US election season has officially started In a year when voters will select the country's next president and decide which party controls the House and Senate.

Iowans went to the polls on January 15 to choose their preferred Republican candidate in the state's distinctive caucus system. Following Iowa, the primary season will gather pace with some of the most important votes taking place in New Hampshire, South Carolina, and Nevada.

Donald Trump handily defeated a narrowly divided Republican field in the Iowa caucuses.

After 99 per cent of the votes were tallied, Trump had 51 per cent of the vote, Rob DeSantis had 21.2 per cent, and Nikki Haley had 19.1 per cent. In a close Republican presidential contest in the state, the former president crushed the previous record margin of victory, which stood at 12 percentage points.

Although each state has its own set of regulations, the number of delegates given to each presidential candidate is decided by the primary elections. The official selection of the party's nominee is then made by the delegates at the Republican and Democratic conventions in the summer.

So when is the US election 2024 and what are the important events happening before then?

When is the US election 2024?

A president and vice president will be chosen by the electorate to serve four-year terms. Here are some of the key dates before the main election:

Primaries

January 23 - New Hampshire, the primary will be a crucial litmus test for Republicans attempting to unseat Trump as the front-runner in the election.

February 3 - South Carolina, the outcome of the 2024 election could show whether President Joe Biden has lost support, despite his clear victory in South Carolina in 2020.

February 6 - Nevada, Nevada Republicans have decided to award their presidential delegates through a caucus. As such, while there will be a primary election in Nevada, it will effectively be pointless. The lone Republican contender taking part is Nikki Haley. The caucus will take place on February 8.

February 24 - South Carolina, the Republican nominee in Nikki Haley's home state will be chosen by voters.

February 27 - Michigan, in an open primary, voters in the crucial swing states will cast their ballots.

March 2 - Republican caucuses in Idaho, Michigan, and Missouri.

March 4 - North Dakota Republican caucuses. The trial for United States v. Donald Trump is set to begin.

March 5 - Last date of mail-in voting in the Iowa Democratic caucuses. Democratic primaries in Alabama, American Samoa, Arkansas, California, Colorado, Maine, Massachusetts, Minnesota, North Carolina, Oklahoma, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Vermont, and Virginia. Republican primaries in Alabama, Alaska, Arkansas, California, Colorado, Maine, Massachusetts, Minnesota, North Carolina, Oklahoma, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Vermont, and Virginia.

March 12 - Georgia, Mississippi and Washington, Hawaii will hold their caucus.

March 19 - Arizona, Florida, Illinois, Kansas and Ohio, voters in Arizona and Ohio will also be considering important senate races that Republicans are attempting to win.

April 2 - Wisconsin primary election will be held.

Conventions

July 12-18 - Republican convention, in Milwaukee, Wisconsin Republican delegates and party officials will convene to formally propose the nominee for the party's primary.

August 19-22 - Democratic convention, in Chicago, Illinois Democratic delegates and party officials will assemble to formally nominate Joe Biden and Kamala Harris for the presidency.

Debates

September 16 - First presidential debate in San Marcos, Texas.

September 25 - Vice-presidential debate in Easton, Pennsylvania.

October 1 - Presidential debate in Petersburg, Virginia.

October 9 - Presidential debate in Salt Lake City, Utah.

Election

The 2024 US presidential election will be held on Tuesday, November 5. All 50 states as well as the District of Columbia will have polls open.

President Biden has announced his run for re-election, keeping Vice President Kamala Harris as his running mate.
